sentences.text: CENTENE CORPORATION Centene Plaza 7700 Forsyth Boulevard St. Louis, Missouri 63105
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 10, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders will be held at Centene Plaza, 7700 Forsyth Boulevard, St. Louis, Missouri, at 9:00 A.M., central daylight savings time, on Tuesday, April 25, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual meetings play an important role in maintaining communications and understanding among our management, Board of Directors and stockholders, and I hope that you will be able to join us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about March 13, 2017, we will begin mailing to our stockholders a proxy notice containing instructions on how to access our Proxy Statement, Annual Review and Annual Report on Form 10-K, and vote online.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information concerning the matters to be considered and voted upon at the Annual Meeting is set forth in the Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders and Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Proxy Statement contains instructions on how you can receive a paper copy of the Proxy Statement, Annual Review and Annual Report on Form 10-K, if you only received a proxy notice by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record you may vote:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: via internet;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: by telephone;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: by mail; or,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To vote by internet or telephone, please follow the instructions on the proxy notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To vote by mail, request a set of proxy materials as instructed on the proxy notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may attend the meeting and vote in person even if you have previously voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in the name of a bank, broker or other holder of record, you will receive instructions from the holder of record that you must follow in order for your shares to be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michael F. Neidorff Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE ABILITY TO HAVE YOUR VOTE COUNTED AT THE MEETING IS AN IMPORTANT STOCKHOLDER RIGHT, AND I HOPE YOU WILL CAST YOUR VOTE IN PERSON OR BY PROXY REGARDLESS OF THE NUMBER OF SHARES YOU HOLD.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE OF 2017 ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9:00 A.M., central daylight savings time, on Tuesday, April 25, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the meeting, we will ask you and our other stockholders to consider and act upon the following matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) to elect three Class I Directors to three-year terms;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) to approve an amendment to the 2012 Stock Incentive Plan to increase the number of shares of common stock reserved for issuance under the plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) to hold an advisory vote to determine the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) to ratify the appointment of KPMG LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) to transact any other business properly presented at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote if you were a stockholder of record at the close of business on February 24, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is important that your shares be represented and voted at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the meeting, please vote by internet, telephone or mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your proxy at any time before its exercise at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please reference the proxy notice for additional information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A list of stockholders entitled to vote will be available at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, you may contact our Secretary, Keith H. Williamson, at our address as set forth above, to make arrangements to review a copy of the stockholder list at our offices located at 7700 Forsyth Boulevard, St. Louis, Missouri, before the meeting, between the hours of 8:00 A.M. and 5:00 P.M., central daylight savings time, on any business day from April 15, 2017, up to one hour prior to the time of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you would like to attend the meeting, please bring evidence to the meeting that you own common stock, such as a stock certificate, or, if your shares are held by a broker, bank or other nominee, please bring a recent brokerage statement or a letter from the nominee confirming your beneficial ownership of such shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You must also bring a form of personal identification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Keith H. Williamson  Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 NOTICE OF MEETING AND PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information About the Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have sent you a notice of this proxy statement because our Board of Directors is soliciting your proxy to vote at our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders or any adjournment or postponement of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When and where is the annual meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When: Tuesday, April 25, 2017 at 9:00 a.m., central daylight savings time
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where: Centene Plaza, 7700 Forsyth Boulevard, St. Louis, Missouri.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THIS PROXY STATEMENT summarizes information about the proposals to be considered at the meeting an other information you may find useful in determining how to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE PROXY CARD is the means by which you actually authorize another person to vote your shares in accordance with the instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors, officers and employees may solicit proxies in person or by telephone, mail, electronic mail or facsimile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will pay the expenses of soliciting proxies, although we will not pay additional compensation to these individuals for soliciting proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will request banks, brokers and other nominees holding shares for a beneficial owner to forward copies of the proxy materials to those beneficial owners and to request instructions for voting those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will eimburse these banks, brokers and other nominees for their related reasonable expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has retained Morrow Sodali, LLC and Saratoga Proxy Consulting, LLC to assist in the solicitation of proxies at an estimated cost of $12,500 each, plus expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are making this proxy statement, our 2016 Annual Review to Stockholders and our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016 available to stockholders for the first time on or about March 13, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is entitled to vote at the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of record of our common stock at the close of business on February 24, 2017 are entitled to one vote per share on each matter properly brought before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy notice states the number of shares you are entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your shares at the meeting in person or by proxy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TO VOTE IN PERSON, you must attend the meeting, and then complete and submit the ballot provided at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in the name of a bank, broker or other nominee holder, you will receive instructions from the holder of record explaining how your shares may be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that, in such an event, you must obtain a proxy, executed in your favor, from the holder of record to be able to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TO VOTE BY PROXY, you must follow the instructions on the proxy notice and then vote by means of the internet, telephone or, if you received your proxy materials by mail, mailing the proxy card in the enclosed postage-paid envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your proxy will be valid only if you vote before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By voting, you will direct the designated persons to vote your shares at the meeting in the manner you specify.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, after requesting paper materials, you complete the proxy card with the exception of the voting instructions, then the designated persons will vote your shares in accordance with the instructions contained therein, and if no choice is specified, such proxies will be voted in favor of the matters set forth in the accompanying Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other business properly comes before the meeting, the designated persons will have the discretion to vote your shares as they deem appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you vote by means of the internet, telephone, or complete and return a proxy card, you may revoke it at any time before it is exercised by taking one of the following actions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: send written notice to Keith H. Williamson, our Secretary, at our address as set forth in the accompanying Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: submit a new vote by means of the mail, internet or telephone; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attend the meeting, notify our Secretary that you are present, and then vote by ballot.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What do I need to do if I plan to attend the meeting in person?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you would like to attend the meeting, please bring evidence to the meeting that you own common stock, such as a stock certificate, or, if your shares are held by a broker, bank or other nominee, please bring a recent brokerage statement or a letter from the nominee confirming your beneficial ownership of such shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You must also bring a form of personal identification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the close of business on February 24, 2017, there were 172,197,847 shares of our common stock outstanding, net of treasury shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our By-Laws require that a majority of the shares of our common stock issued and outstanding on that date be represented, in person or by proxy, at the meeting in order to constitute the quorum we need to transact business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will count abstentions and broker non-votes in determining whether a quorum exists.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote occurs when a nominee holding shares for a beneficial owner does not vote on a particular proposal because the nominee does not have discretionary voting power for that particular item and has not received instructions from the beneficial owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our By-Laws include a majority voting standard for the election of directors in uncontested elections, which are generally defined as elections in which the number of nominees does not exceed the number of directors to be elected at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the majority voting standard, in uncontested elections of directors, such as this election, each director must be elected by the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast with respect to such director by the shares represented and entitled to vote therefor at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the votes cast means that the number of votes cast FOR a director nominee exceeds the number of votes cast AGAINST that director nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our Corporate Governance Guidelines, in this election, any director nominee who receives a greater number of votes AGAINST his or her election than FOR votes must tender his or her resignation to the Board of Directors promptly following certification of the stockholder vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee is required to make a recommendation to the Board of Directors with respect to any such tendered resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors will act on the tendered resignation within 90 days from the certification of the vote and will publicly disclose its decision, including an explanation of its decision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will not count as a vote FOR or AGAINST a director nominees election and thus will have no effect in determining whether a director nominee has received a majority of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of the votes cast at the meeting is necessary to ratify the selection of KPMG LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017, to approve an amendment to our 2012 Stock Incentive Plan and to approve on an advisory non-binding basis, the Companys executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes with respect to each of these proposals will not be considered as votes cast with respect to the matter and thus will have no effect on the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approval of the amendment to the 2012 Stock Incentive Plan is subject to an additional approval requirement set by the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stockholder approval for NYSE purposes is defined as a majority of votes cast on a proposal.

sentences.text: Abstentions will be treated as votes cast and will have the effect of a vote against the proposal.

sentences.text: The frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation receiving the greatest number of votes (every one, two or three years) will be considered the frequency recommended by stockholders.

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will have no effect on such vote.

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is not aware of any matters that are expected to come before the meeting other than those referred to in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other matter should properly come before the meeting, the persons appointed as proxies by the Board of Directors intend to vote the proxies in accordance with their best judgment.

sentences.text: The chairperson of the meeting may refuse to allow the transaction of any business not presented beforehand, or to acknowledge the nomination of any person not made, in compliance with the below procedures.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL ONE: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal One: Election Of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominees and Continuing Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Certificate of Incorporation provides that the Board is to be divided into three classes serving for staggered three- year terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our By-Laws, our Board of Directors has the authority to fix the number of Directors, provided that the Board must have between five and eleven members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The first proposal on the agenda for the meeting is the election of three nominees to serve as Class I Directors for three-year terms beginning at the meeting and ending at our 2020 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2017, Ms. Escarra informed the Company that continued service on the Board of Directors would unduly interfere with a business opportunity, and as a result decided not to stand for re-election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a practice of good corporate governance, the Board of Directors is rebalancing the three classes of directors by nominating Robert K. Ditmore, a current Class II Director, for election as a Class I Director at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No director, including any director standing for election, or any associate of a director, is a party adverse to us or any of our subsidiaries in any material proceeding or has any material interest adverse to us or any of our subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No director, including any director standing for election, is related by blood, marriage or adoption to any other director or any executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has nominated Michael F. Neidorff, Robert K. Ditmore and Richard A. Gephardt for re-election to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect that Mr. Neidorff, Mr. Ditmore and Mr. Gephardt will be able to serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any of them are not able to serve, proxies may be voted for a substitute nominee or nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the election of these three nominees is in our best interests and the best interests of our stockholders and recommends a vote FOR the election of the three nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance and Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that good corporate governance is important to ensure that we are managed for the long term benefit of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also recognize the connection between good corporate governance and our ability to create and sustain value for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Ethics and Compliance Program provides methods by which we further enhance operations, safeguard against fraud and abuse and help assure that our values are reflected in everything we do.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also reviewed and believe we are in compliance with the provisions of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the rules of the SEC, and the listing standards of the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines addressing, among other things, director qualifications and responsibilities, duties of key Board committees, director compensation and management succession.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A current copy of the Corporate Governance Guidelines is posted on our website, www.centene.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has adopted a Business Ethics and Conduct Policy (the Policy) which is applicable to all directors, officers and employees of the Company, including the Principal Executive Officer, Principal Financial Officer and Principal Accounting Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While no policy can replace the thoughtful behavior of an ethical director, officer or employee, we believe the Policy will, among other things, focus our Board and management on areas of ethical risk, provide guidance in recognizing and dealing with ethical issues, provide mechanisms to report unethical conduct and generally help foster a culture of honesty and accountability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any amendment or waiver of the Policy may only be made by the Board or a committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A current copy of the Policy is posted on our website, www.centene.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any future amendments or waivers of the Policy will be promptly disclosed on our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our policy concerning pre-approval of related party transactions is incorporated into the provisions of the Policy regarding conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the Policy, our directors, officers and employees are responsible for disclosing any transaction or relationship that reasonably could be expected to give rise to a conflict of interest to the Chief Compliance Officer of the Company or the Board of Directors, in the case of an executive officer or director, who shall be responsible for determining whether such transaction or relationship constitutes a conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors oversees the Companys enterprise-wide risk management processes, with assistance provided by Board committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management executes risk management activities, which includes identifying, assessing, and aligning actions necessary to manage risk consistent with the Companys strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The oversight responsibility of the Board of Directors and its committees is enabled by quarterly risk reporting to the Board from executive management, designed to provide visibility about the identification, assessment and management of critical risks, including strategic, operational, financial, compensation, public policy, compliance, regulatory, nvestment, information security and other risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, the Board of Directors and its committees are informed of emerging risks that could affect the Companys risk profile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also evaluates Company performance in relation o tolerance levels established in our risk appetite framework.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, the Board uses its committees to assist in its risk oversight function:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committee assists in the oversight of our financial and reporting risks, disclosure risk and procedures, business ethics and conduct risks, investment, and risk assessment and management policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Executive Vice President of Internal Audit & Risk Management, who reports to the Audit Committee and Chief Executive Officer, assists the Company in identifying and evaluating risk management controls and methodologies to address risks and provides reports to the Audit Committee quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee meets privately
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate purpose is to transform the health of our communities, one person at a time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with this purpose, diversity and inclusion are among our highest priorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors believes that investing in training, diversity, education, and community-improvement initiatives is important to attracting and retaining a talented workforce.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage our Board members, senior executives, and rank-and-file employees to become actively involved with organizations making a positive impact on communities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our efforts include the intentional placement of service centers and other facilities in economically challenged locations such as Ferguson, Missouri as well as spending with, and mentorship of, diverse suppliers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We revised our Corporate Governance Guidelines to make clear that we are committed to a policy of inclusiveness which includes actively identifying and recruiting diverse candidates, including women and minorities, as part of the process for selecting new Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our local approach model, we often recruit individuals from local communities to serve as directors on the governing boards of our regulated health plan subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of such 93 individuals serving at the start of 2017, there was a high level of diversity with roughly one-third of the directors being women and over 40% being African American, Hispanic, Asian or Native American.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards Role in Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As reflected in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Boards primary responsibilities include planning for Chief Executive Officer (CEO) succession and monitoring and advising on succession planning for other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards goal is to have a long term and continuing program for effective senior leadership development and succession.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also has contingency plans in place for emergencies such as departure, death, or disability of the CEO or other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert K. Ditmore (Chair), Orlando Ayala, David L. Steward and Tommy G. Thompson were members of the Compensation Committee during 2016.

sentences.text: During 2016, none of our executive officers served as a director or member of the Compensation Committee, or other committee serving an equivalent function, of any other entity that has one or more of its executive officers serving as a member of our Board of Directors or Compensation Committee.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the current members of our Compensation Committee has ever been an officer or employee of Centene or any of our subsidiaries.

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has also established a Government and Regulatory Affairs Committee, which is co-chaired by Richard A. Gephardt and Tommy G. Thompson; a Technology Committee chaired by Orlando Ayala; and a Compliance Committee chaired by Michael Neidorff.

sentences.text: ensuring independent review of any potential issues, and enforcing appropriate corrective actions;

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: providing specific guidance and directives to Management for the remediation and implementation of Compliance Program initiatives and updates.

sentences.text: Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has responsibility for establishing broad corporate policies and reviewing our overall performance ather than day-to-day operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards primary responsibility is to oversee the management of the Company and, in doing so, serve the best interests of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board selects, evaluates and provides for the succession of executive officers and, subject to stockholder election, directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It reviews and approves corporate objectives and strategies, and evaluates significant policies and proposed major commitments of corporate esources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management keeps the directors informed of its activities through regular written reports and presentations at Board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board currently combines the role of Chairman of the Board with the role of Chief Executive Officer, coupled with a Presiding Director position to further strengthen the governance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes this provides an efficient and effective leadership model for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Combining the Chairman and CEO roles fosters clear accountability, effective decision-making, and alignment on corporate strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board periodically reviews its leadership structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assure effective independent oversight, the Board has adopted a number of governance practices, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a strong, independent, clearly-defined Presiding Director role;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executive sessions of the independent directors in connection with every Board meeting; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual performance evaluations of the Chairman and CEO by the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has appointed Robert K. Ditmore Presiding Director to preside at all executive sessions of non-management directors, as defined under the rules of the NYSE.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees our activities in the area of compensation and benefits (generally with regard to all employees and specifically with regard to our Named Executive Officers, or NEOs, identified in the Summary Compensation Table, as well as other officers) and reviews and makes recommendations concerning compensation- related matters to be submitted to the Board and/or stockholders for approval.

sentences.text: evaluating compensation policies and practices to determine if they may be influencing employees to take excessive risks;

sentences.text: Members of management assist the Compensation Committee in its responsibilities by providing recommendations for he Compensation Committees approval concerning the design of our compensation program for our executive officers other than our Chief Executive Officer, including our NEOs, as well as recommended award levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The design of our compensation program for our Chief Executive Officer is recommended by the Compensation Committee and approved by the Board without any approval of the Chairman, who is the Companys Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered information and data regarding executive compensation supplied by management and by Willis Towers Watson and Exequity, LLC, compensation and benefits consultants retained by management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, F.W. Cook & Co., Inc., an independent compensation consulting group, has been engaged directly by the Compensation Committee to provide advice with respect to base salaries, bonus targets and long term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Company utilized Willis Towers Watson and Exequity, LLC to provide advice with respect to the base salaries, bonus targets and long term incentives of our officers, including our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consultants analyzed the compensation levels of the NEOs of the industry peer group developed by Willis Towers Watson for the most recently completed fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed under the CD&A, the Compensation Committee considered this information, along with a variety of other factors, in reviewing our executive compensation in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has reviewed the independence of each of Willis Towers Watson, Exequity, LLC and F.W. Cook & Co., Inc. in light of SEC rules and NYSE listing standards, including the following factors: (1) other services provided to us by the consulting firm; (2) fees paid by us as a percentage of consulting firms total revenue; (3) policies or procedures maintained by the consulting firm that are designed to prevent a conflict of interest; (4) any business or personal relationships between the compensation consultant and a member of the Compensation Committee; (5) any company stock owned by the compensation consultant; and (6) any business or personal relationships between our executive officers and the senior advisor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee discussed these considerations and concluded that the compensation consultants work for the committee does not raise any conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee delegates to management the authority to grant certain stock options and restricted stock units under the 2012 Stock Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chief Executive Officer is authorized to issue awards (other than to himself) of up to 60,000 shares to any newly hired executive and up to 24,000 shares to any one person during a calendar year, and is required to report any such grants to the Compensation Committee at the following Compensation Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The delegation of authority may be terminated by the Compensation Committee at any time and for any reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All internal promotions and equity grants to a corporate officer and all offers to any Executive Officer (as defined by Rule 3b-7 under the Exchange Act) require Compensation Committee approval.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process followed by the Nominating and Governance Committee to identify and evaluate director candidates includes requests to Board members and others for recommendations, meetings from time to time to evaluate biographical information and background material relating to potential candidates and interviews of selected candidates by members of the Nominating and Governance Committee and the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering whether to recommend any particular candidate for inclusion in the Boards slate of recommended director nominees, the Nominating and Governance Committee will apply the criteria set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These criteria include the candidates integrity, business acumen, knowledge of our business and industry, age, experience, diligence, conflicts of interest and the ability to act in the interests of all stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee does not assign specific weights to particular criteria and no particular criterion is a prerequisite for each prospective nominee.

sentences.text: We believe that the backgrounds and qualifications of our directors, considered as a group, should provide a composite mix of experience, knowledge and abilities that will allow the Board to fulfill its responsibilities.

sentences.text: Stockholders also have the right under our By-Laws to directly nominate director candidates, without any action or recommendation on the part of the Nominating and Governance Committee or the Board, by following the procedures set forth under Submission of Future Stockholder Proposals of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Tenure and Commitment to Refreshment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are proud of our Board of Directors, which for years has maintained excellent chemistry and internal working dynamics while having members with differing political affiliations and diverse backgrounds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the existing members of our Board continue to provide valuable insights and have contributed significantly to the success of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recognizes, however, the importance of planning for the succession of Board leadership and of bringing on new members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We anticipate that the Board will add one or two new members over the course of the next year and that such new members will reflect our commitment to diversity and inclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will give appropriate attention to written communications that are submitted by stockholders and other interested parties and will respond as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Nominating and Governance Committee, with the assistance of our Chief Executive Officer, is primarily responsible for monitoring communications from stockholders and other interested parties and for providing copies or summaries to the other directors as he or she considers appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under procedures approved by a majority of the independent directors, communications are forwarded to all directors if they relate to important substantive matters and include suggestions or comments considered to be important for the directors to know.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and interested parties who wish to send communications on any topic to the Board should address such communications to Board of Directors c/o Corporate Secretary, Centene Corporation, 7700 Forsyth Boulevard, St. Louis, Missouri 63105.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stockholder or interested party who wishes to communicate directly with our Presiding Director, or with our non-employee directors as a group, should also follow the foregoing method.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL TWO: ADVISORY RESOLUTION TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal Two: Advisory Resolution to Approve Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, our stockholders approved the Companys executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act), we are again holding an advisory vote on the Companys executive compensation, as described in this proxy statement (commonly referred to as say-on-pay).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the results of the vote we conducted at the 2011 Annual Meeting on the frequency of say-on-pay votes, we have been presenting a say-on-pay vote every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking stockholders to again vote on the frequency of the say-on-pay vote in Proposal Four.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we maintain our current frequency, it is anticipated that the next say-on-pay vote will be at the 2018 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage stockholders to review the Compensation Discussion and Analysis included in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program has been designed to implement the Companys compensation philosophy of paying for performance by making decisions based on promoting the Companys corporate mission statement and creating long term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This philosophy is evidenced by the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide a significant part of executive compensation in the form of at-risk annual incentive and long term incentive compensation; for example, we have withheld or reduced payments under our incentive programs when financial measures have not been fully achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual incentive and long term incentive opportunities are substantially based on corporate financial measures closely correlated with achieving long term stockholder value, such as earnings per share, revenue growth targets, pre-tax operating margins and total shareholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual and long term incentive opportunities also reflect the impact to the current year income for new contracts awarded that drive future revenue growth and take into account the costs associated with the contract procurements which occur prior to revenue generation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide a mix of short term, long term, cash and non-cash compensation that we believe allows us to strike a balance between offering competitive executive compensation packages, motivating our executives without fostering excessive risk-taking and linking Executive Officer compensation with the creation of long term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors strongly endorses the Companys executive compensation program and recommends that stockholders vote in favor of the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders approve the compensation of those NEOs listed in the Summary Compensation Table of this proxy statement, who we refer to in this proxy statement as the NEOs, as disclosed pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and the tabular and narrative disclosure included herein under Information about Executive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the vote is advisory, it will not be binding upon the Board of Directors or the Compensation Committee and neither the Board of Directors nor the Compensation Committee will be required to take any action as a result of the outcome of the vote on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee strongly considers the views of the Companys shareholders when making compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Compensation Committee monitors the results of the annual advisory say-on-pay proposal and incorporates such results as one of many factors considered in connection with the discharge of its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this Proxy Statement for a more detailed discussion of the actions the Committee took during 2016 based on shareholder feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR the approval of the compensation of the NEOs, as disclosed in this proxy statement pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal Three: Approval of Amendment to the 2012 Stock Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Amended and Restated 2012 Stock Incentive Plan (the 2012 Plan) is comprised of the following
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4,600,000 shares of common stock initially approved in April 2012,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3,500,000 shares of common stock approved in April 2014,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2,211,406 shares of common stock under the 2003 Stock Incentive Plan that were previously cancelled and converted to shares available under the 2012 Stock Incentive Plan, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5,770,104 shares of common stock assumed with the Health Net acquisition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n March 2016, the Company completed the acquisition of Health Net.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the acquisition, 5,770,104 shares were assumed by the Company from the Health Net, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amended and Restated 2006 Long-Term Incentive Plan (Health Net Pool) and consolidated into the 2012 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares assumed by Centene from the Health Net Pool into he 2012 Plan are only available for awards to legacy Health Net employees and employees joining the Company after March 24, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A roll forward of the 2012 Plan activity as of December 31, 2016 is shown below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Shares Authorized     Total Shares Available   Shares approved under the 2012 Plan   8,100,000     468,441  Shares converted from the 2003 Stock Incentive Plan   2,211,406     379,726  Total shares under the 2012 Plan, prior to Health Net acquisition   10,311,406     848,167  Assumption of Health Net Pool into the 2012 Plan   5,770,104    5,376,101  Total shares under the 2012 Plan as of December 31, 2016   16,081,510    6,224,268
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, a total of 6,224,268 shares were available for future awards under the Companys 2012 Plan, of which 5,376,101 shares are restricted for grant to legacy Health Net employees and employees joining the company after March 24, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, our Board of Directors adopted an amendment to our Amended and Restated 2012 Stock Incentive Plan (2012 Amended Plan) that would increase the number of shares of common stock authorized for grant under the Companys 2012 Plan by 6,900,000 subject to adjustment in the event of stock splits and other similar events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon approval of the amendment, shares remaining under the Health Net Pool will be terminated, resulting in an incremental share increase of 1,523,899, and the shares available under the 2012 Amended Plan will be available to be granted to all employees of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A reconciliation of the proposed amendment to the 2012 Plan is shown below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposed increase to the 2012 Plan   6,900,000  Termination of shares in the Health Net Pool   (5,376,101)  Net proposed increase in 2012 Plan   1,523,899

sentences.text: PROPOSAL THREE: APPROVAL OF AMENDMENT TO THE 2012 STOCK INCENTIVE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering whether to approve the amendment to the 2012 Plan, the Committee considered a number of factors including the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the number of shares remaining available for new awards under the 2012 Plan, taking into account the number only available for awards to legacy Health Net employees and employees joining the Company after March 24, 2016;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys desire to have what it expects to be sufficient capacity under the 2012 Plan to grant equity award for the next two to three years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys historical average gross burn rate (the number of equity awards granted during the year divided by the weighted average number of shares outstanding during the year);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys historical equity overhang (the number of shares subject to equity awards outstanding at the end of the fiscal year divided by the number of shares outstanding at the end of the fiscal year);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Companys historical dilution (the sum of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) the number of shares subject to equity awards outstanding at the end of the fiscal year and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (y) the number of shares available for future grants, divided by the number of shares outstanding at the end of the fiscal year); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the restrictions of the Health Net Pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company attempts to manage the overall dilution resulting from our use of equity compensation while maintaining the ability to attract, motivate and retain talented employees and executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the three years 2014-2016, the Companys average gross burn rate, equity overhang and dilution were 1.6%, 3.8%, and 6.9%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Average dilution for 2014-2016 excluding legacy Health Net shares that are restricted under the terms of the merger agreement was 5.6%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its review of the relevant considerations, including the fact that the Companys three-year average gross burn rate based on the 2017 Institutional Shareholder Services calculation was 3.18%, compared to the benchmark of 2.56% for our industry group, the Committee determined that the proposed share increase to the 2012 Plan is in line with our peers as well as necessary to retain equity compensation as an important recruiting and retention tool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined in light of these factors, among others, that it was appropriate to recommend that the Board adopt the amendment to the 2012 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The increase in reserved shares under the 2012 Amended Plan will be effective subject to the approval of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a more complete description of the 2012 Amended Plan, as proposed, please see Summary of the 2012 Amended Plan below and the copy of the 2012 Amended Plan, included as Appendix A to this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use the 2012 Plan to attract and retain talented employees in a highly competitive employment market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management carefully considers all proposed grants under the 2012 Plan, and our Compensation Committee or Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer, with authority delegated from our Board of Directors, approves all awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors believes that our future success depends, in large part, upon our ability to maintain a competitive position to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attract new employees and executives with competitive compensation packages;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: retain our existing executives who are attractive candidates to other companies in our industries;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: motivate and recognize our high performing individuals; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensure the availability of stock incentives for employees we hire as a result of acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, our Board of Directors believes the 2012 Amended Plan is in our best interests and the best interests of our stockholders and recommends a vote FOR the Plan Amendment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the 2012 Amended Plan is not approved at the meeting, the Board will reconsider the alternatives available to help attract, retain and motivate key individuals who are currently our employees or who become employees as the result of any future acquisitions, and the 2012 Plan would continue in effect in accordance with its existing terms.

sentences.text: Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Optionees receive the right to purchase a specified number of shares of our common stock at a specified option price and are subject to such other terms and conditions as are specified in connection with the option grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may grant options only at an exercise price that is equal to or greater than the fair market value of our common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under present law, incentive stock options and options intended to qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code may not be granted at an exercise price less than the fair market value of our common stock on the date of grant or less than 110% of the fair market value in the case of incentive stock options granted to optionees holding more than 10% of the voting power of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2012 Amended Plan permits the following forms of payment of the exercise price of options:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: payment by cash, check or in connection with a cashless exercise through a broker;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: surrender of shares of our common stock;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any other lawful means (other than promissory notes); or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any combination of these forms of payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards of restricted stock entitle recipients to acquire shares of our common stock, subject to our right to repurchase all or part of such shares from the recipient at the issue price or other stated formula or price in the event that the conditions specified in the applicable award are not satisfied before the end of the applicable restriction period established for such award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock unit awards entitle recipients to acquire shares of our common stock in the future, and we promise to complete the issuance of stock to the recipient promptly after the award vests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The right to acquire the stock will be subject to terms and conditions established by the Compensation Committee and the shares received may be subject to restrictions or repurchase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stock appreciation right, or SAR, is an award entitling the holder upon exercise to receive an amount in common stock determined in whole or in part by reference to appreciation, from and after the date of grant, in the fair market value of a share of common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs may be based solely on appreciation in the fair market value of common stock or on a comparison of such appreciation with some other measure of market growth such as appreciation in a recognized market index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs may be issued in tandem with options or as stand-alone rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may grant SARs only at an exercise price that is equal to or greater than the fair market value of our common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Stock Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has discretion to issue other stock based awards that have a value based on the value of shares, including but not limited to grants of stock and grants of rights to receive stock in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms and conditions of other stock based awards, if any, will be determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to restricted stock awards, the Compensation Committee may set performance measures designed to satisfy the requirements of Code Section 162(m) which will be set forth in the award agreement pertaining to the grant of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The time period during which the performance measures must be met is called the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance measures authorized by the 2012 Amended Plan with respect to restricted stock awards designed to satisfy the requirements of Code Section 162(m) include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: net earnings or net income (before or after taxes);

sentences.text: Incentive Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, a participant will not recognize taxable income upon the grant or exercise of an incentive stock option, provided the participant is an employee on the date of exercise or his or her last day of employment was no more than three months (or 12 months if the participant is disabled) before the date of exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, a participant will recognize taxable income with respect to an incentive stock option only upon the sale of common stock acquired through the exercise of the option, referred to below as ISO Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise of an incentive stock option, however, may subject the participant to the alternative minimum tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, the tax consequences of selling ISO Stock will vary depending on the date on which it is sold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participan sells ISO Stock more than two years from the date the option was granted and more than one year from the date the option was exercised, then the participant will recognize a long term capital gain in an amount equal to the excess of the sale price of the ISO Stock over the exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant sells ISO Stock before satisfying the above waiting periods, called a disqualifying disposition, then all or a portion of the gain recognized by the participant will be ordinary compensation income and the remaining gain, if any, will be a capital gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of the ordinary gain will be: (1) the lesser of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the amount realized on the disposition of the shares or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the fair market value of the shares on the date of exercise; minus (2) the exercise price of the stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of capital gain will be the amount not already realized as ordinary gain that the participant realizes upon disposition of the shares that exceeds the fair market value of those shares on the date the participant exercised the option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This capital gain will be a long term capital gain if the participant has held the ISO Stock for more than one year before the date of sale.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a participant sells ISO Stock for less than the exercise price, then the participant will recognize a capital loss in an amount equal to the excess of the exercise price over the sale price of the ISO Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This capital loss will be a long term capital loss if the participant has held the ISO Stock for more than one year before the date of sale.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Statutory Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As in the case of an incentive stock option, a participant will not recognize taxable income upon the grant of a non-statutory stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unlike the case of an incentive stock option, however, a participant who exercises a non-statutory stock option generally will recognize ordinary compensation income in an amount equal to the excess of the fair market value of the common stock acquired through the exercise of the option, referred to below as NSO Stock, on the exercise date over the exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to any NSO Stock, a participant will have a tax basis equal to the exercise price plus any income recognized upon the exercise of the option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon selling NSO Stock, a participant generally will recognize a capital gain or loss in an amount equal to the difference between the sale price of the NSO Stock and the participants tax basis in the NSO Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This capital gain or loss will be a long term gain or loss if the participant has held the NSO Stock for more than one year before the date of the sale.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Early-Exercise Alternative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may permit a participant to exercise the unvested portion of an option, subject to our right to repurchase the unvested shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, a participant who exercises the unvested portion of an option and then makes a valid election under Section 83(b) of the Internal Revenue Code within 30 days of the exercise date should be taxed as if the underlying shares were vested shares with the consequences described above under Incentive Stock Options or Non-Statutory Stock Options (whichever is applicable).

sentences.text: Otherwise, the participant will be taxed as described above under Incentive Stock Options or Non-Statutory Stock Options, whichever is applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant will not recognize taxable income upon the grant of an award of restricted stock unless the participant makes a Section 83(b) election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant makes a valid Section 83(b) election within 30 days of the date of the grant, then the participant will recognize ordinary compensation income, for the year in which the award is granted, in an amount equal to the difference between the fair market value of our common stock at the time the award is granted and the purchase price paid for the common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a valid Section 83(b) election is not made, then the participant will recognize ordinary compensation income, at the time that the forfeiture provisions or restrictions on transfer lapse, in an amount equal to the difference between the fair market value of our common stock at the time of such lapse and the original purchase price paid for the common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The participant will have a tax basis in the common stock acquired equal to the sum of the price paid and the amount of ordinary compensation income recognized
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the disposition of the common stock acquired pursuant to an award of restricted stock, the participant will recognize a capital gain or loss equal to the difference between the sale price of the common stock and the participants tax basis in the common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This capital gain or loss will be a long term capital gain or loss if the shares are held for more than one year from the earlier of the date that the participant made a Section 83(b) election or the forfeiture provisions and restrictions on transfer lapsed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant will not have income upon the grant of a restricted stock unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant will have compensation income in the amount of any cash delivered and the fair market value of any common stock delivered in payment of an amount due under the restricted stock unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When stock distributed in settlement of a restricted stock unit is sold, the participant will have capital gain or loss equal to the sales proceeds less the value of the stock on the date the award was settled.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any capital gain or loss will be long term if the participant held the stock for more than one year, and otherwise will be short term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant will not have income upon the grant of a SAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant will have compensation income upon the exercise of a SAR equal to the appreciation in the value of the stock underlying the SAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the stock distributed in settlement of the SAR is sold, the participant will have capital gain or loss equal to the sales proceeds less the value of the stock on the date of exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any capital gain or loss will be long term if the participant held the stock for more than one year, and otherwise will be short term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Stock Based Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tax consequences associated with any other stock based award will vary depending on the specific terms of the award, including whether the award has a readily ascertainable fair market value, whether or not the award is subject to forfeiture provisions or restrictions on transfer, any applicable holding period and the participants tax basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acceleration of income inclusion, additional taxes and interest apply to nonqualified deferred compensation that is not compliant with Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be compliant with Section 409A, rules with respect to the terms of awards, timing of elections to defer compensation, distribution events and funding must all be satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most awards under the 2012 Amended Plan are exempt from the Section 409A rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, with respect to those awards under the 2012 Amended Plan which could be subject to the Section 409A rules, the 2012 Amended Plan includes provisions which are intended to prevent awards under the Plan from triggering the adverse tax consequences applicable to deferred compensation under Section 409A.

sentences.text: Under Section 280G of the Internal Revenue Code and Section 4999 of the Internal Revenue Code, the Company is prohibited from deducting any excess parachute payment to an individual, and the individual must pay a 20% excise tax on any excess parachute payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An individuals parachute payments which exceed his or her average annual compensation will generally be treated as excess parachute payments if the presen value of such payments equals or exceeds three times the individuals average annual compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A payment generally may be considered a parachute payment if it is contingent on a change in control of the Company.

sentences.text: Tax Consequences to Centene
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of an award under the 2012 Amended Plan generally will have no tax consequences to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, in general, neither the exercise of an incentive stock option nor the sale of any common stock acquired under the 2012 Amended Plan will have any tax consequences to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally will be entitled to a business-expense deduction, however, with respect to any ordinary compensation income recognized by a participant under the 2012 Amended Plan, including in connection with a restricted stock award or SAR or as a result of the exercise of a non-statutory stock option or a disqualifying disposition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax deduction of compensation is generally subject to the limits of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m)(6), which was enacted as part of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act amended the Code to limit the amount that certain healthcare insurers and providers, including the Company, may deduct for compensation to any employee in excess of $500,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This new legislation does not create any exceptions for performance-based compensation.

sentences.text: Proposal Four: Advisory Vote on Frequency of Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As mentioned above, Section 14A of the Exchange Act requires that we include in this proxy statement a separate non-binding stockholder vote to advise on whether the frequency of the say-on-pay vote should occur every one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You have the option to vote for any one of the three options, or to abstain on the matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation is the best approach for the Company at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In formulating its recommendation, the Board of Directors considered that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation will allow the Companys stockholders to provide input on the Companys executive compensation programs for our Named Executive Officers on a more consistent basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, an annual advisory vote on executive compensation is consistent with the Companys practice of seeking input from, and engaging in discussions with, its stockholders on corporate governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the vote is non-binding, the Board of Directors will take into account the outcome of the vote when making future decisions about the frequency for holding an advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote for the option of ONE YEAR for the frequency which the Company will conduct an advisory vote on executive compensation.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMG LLP audited our financial statements for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the independent external audit firm retained to audit our financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointed KPMG LLP to serve as our independent registered public accounting firm for the current fiscal year, and we are asking stockholders to ratify this appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMG LLP has been retained as our external auditor continuously since 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder ratification of this selection is not required by our By-Laws or other applicable legal requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is, however, submitting the selection of KPMG LLP to stockholders for ratification as a matter of good corporate practice.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the selection is ratified, the Audit Committee, in its discretion, may direct the appointment of a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if the Audit Committee believes that a change would be in the best interests of the Company and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect that representatives of KPMG LLP will be present at our Annual Meeting of Stockholders to answer appropriate questions.

sentences.text: They will have the opportunity to make a statement if they desire to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of the votes cast at the meeting is being sought to ratify the selection of KPMG LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the current fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee operates under a written charter adopted by the Companys Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charter, which was last amended in February of 2009, outlines the Audit Committees duties and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews the charter annually and works with the Board of Directors to amend the charter based on the Audit Committees evolving responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee charter is available on the Companys website at www.centene.com/investors/corporate-governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of the Companys Board of Directors consists of three non-employee directors who are independent under the rules of the NYSE, the rules of the SEC and the Companys Standards for Director Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Audit Committee members are considered Audit Committee Financial Experts as defined by the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee assists the Board of Directors in its oversight of the accounting and financial reporting process of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the Audit Committee has responsibility for providing independent objective oversight of the accounting and financial reporting process of the Company, selecting and evaluating the independent registered public accounting firm, which reports directly to the Audit Committee and oversees the performance of the Companys internal audit function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has the primary responsibility for the preparation of the Companys financial statements and the overall reporting process, for maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting and, with the assistance of the Companys internal auditors, for assessing the effectiveness of the Companys internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys independent registered public accounting firm is responsible for performing an independent audit of the Companys financial statements in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States)(the PCAOB), expressing an opinion as to the conformity of the financial statements with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of America, and auditing managements assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMG LLP has served as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm since 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management represented to the Audit Committee that the financial statements were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and that there were no material weaknesses in its internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee met and held discussions with management and KPMG LLP to review and discuss the financial statements and the Companys internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has also discussed with KPMG LLP the firms judgments as to the quality and the acceptability of the Companys financial reporting and such other matters as are required to be discussed by PCAOB Auditing Standard No. 16, Communication with Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KPMG LLP also provided the Audit Committee with the written disclosures and the letter required by applicable requirements of the PCAOB regarding the independent accountants communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has discussed with KPMG LLP their independence with respect to the Company, including a review of audit and non-audit fees and services and concluded that KPMG LLP is independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fulfilling its oversight responsibilities for reviewing the services performed by KPMG LLP, the Audit committee has the sole authority to select, evaluate and replace the outside auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee discusses the overall scope of the annual audit, the proposed audit fee, and annually evaluates the qualifications, performance and independence of KPMG LLP as independent registered public accountants and the performance of its lead audit partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee meets regularly with the internal auditors and independent registered public accounting firm, with and without
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 1 - 2016 Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are a diversified, multi-national healthcare enterprise that provides services to government sponsored healthcare programs, focusing on under-insured and uninsured individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide member-focused services through locally based staff by assisting in accessing care, coordinating referrals to related health and social services and addressing member concerns and questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n March 2016, we acquired Health Net, a publicly traded managed care organization that delivers healthcare services hrough health plans and government-sponsored managed care plans, for approximately $6.0 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The acquisition allows us to offer a more comprehensive and scalable portfolio of solutions and provides opportunity for additional growth across the combined companys markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a transformative and successful year for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The acquisition of Health Net and growth and performance in the business led to strong financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our performance is summarized as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total revenues of $40.6 billion, an increase of 78% over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diluted earnings per share (EPS) of $3.41, an increase of 18% over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted Diluted EPS of $4.43, an increase of 41% over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total operating cash flows of $1,851 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return on Equity of 14% in 2016, and a three year average of 17%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return on Assets of 4% in 2016, and a three year average of 5%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return on Invested Capital of 8% in 2016, and a three year average growth of 11%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the full year 2016, our stock price decreased 14%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The decrease was the result of the uncertainty around the future of government sponsored health care created by the effect of the presidential election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As more information around the new administrations proposals has become available and with our proven history of adapting to the needs of our government customers, our stock price has recovered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall, our three year Compound Annual Growth Rates (CAGR) have been:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total revenues of 55%;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diluted EPS of 34% and Adjusted Diluted EPS of 44%;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EBITDA of 65%;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash flow from operations of 69%; and,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock performance of 24%.
