sentences.text: Base Salaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2015, the Compensation Committee evaluated 2016 base salaries and took into account the Companys 2016 estimated revenue in excess of $40 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Willis Towers Watson compared our NEOs base salaries to market data, and on average, our base salaries for 2016 were below the 50th percentile of the healthcare industry peer group and of the general industry peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments to base salaries are determined based on merit and market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs were paid competitive base salaries determined by the evaluation of multiple factors: business results for the prior year, individual performance, as well as the market value for each specific job.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since Centene is a pay for performance Company, only 7% of the Chief Executive Officers and, on average, 16% of the other NEOs compensation is comprised of base salary.

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee assigned an annual cash incentive plan target opportunity of 150% of salary for the CEO and 100% of salary for the other NEOs based on a review of industry data, as discussed in Section 3: Compensation Philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee rewards NEOs with an Annual Cash Incentive bonus for achieving the Companys EPS objective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee assesses how each NEO contributed to achieving this EPS objective and other pre-determined objectives approved by the Compensation Committee earlier in the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee determined that 70% of the incentive target will be aligned with the diluted EPS target, and the remaining 30% will be aligned with individual performance objectives, with a maximum payout of 200% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee follows a two-step process to determine the bonus earned each year:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Achievement of EPS Objective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In early 2016, the Compensation Committee determined that if the company reached its 2016 Adjusted Diluted EPS target of $4.18, then a bonus would be paid at target based on each NEOs contribution to that target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the Companys 2016 Adjusted Diluted EPS from continuing operations was $4.43, the Compensation Committee determined to interpolate the EPS objective component at $4.38 which resulted in a payout of 174% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This excluded a $0.05 diluted EPS benefit related to the early adoption of the stock-based compensation accounting standard, as well as the incorporation of retirement provisions in our stock-based compensation agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Evaluation of Individual Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, management and the Compensation Committee assessed each NEOs individual performance against pre-determined goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the individual performance goals were met, exceeded or not met, then the individual performance component of the Annual Cash Incentive equaled, exceeded or was less than the target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 3 - Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following principles guide the Companys compensation philosophy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for PerformanceOur overall compensation philosophy is to pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executives compensation is directly linked to performance and the achievement of both Company and individual goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Superior performance and the achievement of goals results in higher compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Create Long Term Stockholder ValueBoth performance-based and service-based stock awards with meaningful retention requirements are used to encourage sustained shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Foster a Culture of Risk Management and ComplianceA portion of NEO compensation is based on meeting individual goals that align with our corporate mission statement and promote a culture of compliance with rules, regulations and the Companys vision and values and rewarding those who mitigate business risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract and Retain Top Executive TalentWe offer competitive pay to attract, motivate and retain industry executives with the skills and experience to drive superior long term Company performance in a high growth company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Results of the April 2016 Say-on-Pay Vote & Changes to the Compensation Program in 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee monitors the results of the annual advisory say-on-pay proposal and considers such results as one of many factors in connection with the discharge of its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our April 2016 Annual Meeting, approximately 89% of our shareholders voted to approve our fiscal 2015 executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While shareholders expressed a wide variety of views about executive compensation, we valued the insights we received as we reached out to gain a more thorough understanding of their comments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of feedback from our shareholders, the Compensation Committee changed the mix of PSUs and RSUs that executives receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, restricted stock awards were made up of 50% PSUs and 50% RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective with the Companys annual stock grants made in December 2016, awards made to the NEOs were made up of 60% PSUs and 40% RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INFORMATION ABOUT EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview of the Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee establishes and administers the executive compensation philosophy and program and assists the Board of Directors in the development and oversight of all aspects of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presented in the table below are highlights of our compensation practices:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do    Pay for Performance A significant portion of our NEOs compensation is tied to performance with clearly articulated financial goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Compensation Risk Assessment We regularly risks related to our compensation program and we condu risk assessments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive Compensation Each component of the NEOs annual total direct compensation is targeted to the 50th percentile for both the Health Care Industry peer group and the General Industry peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Requirements We maintain rigorous ownership requirements for our directors, executives and members of senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEOs requiremen annual base pay; other NEOs requirements are 2.5x ann pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Grants Reward Future Performance Beginning in 2015, PSU grants vest at the end of the three-year period based on two three-year performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawbacks We can recover performance-based cash an incentive compensation paid to executives in various circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Formula Based Annual Incentive Plan Beginning in 2015, awards under the Annual Cash Incentive plan are formula based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Compensation Consultant The Compens Committee retains an independent compensation consu advise the Committee on executive compensation matte    Tally Sheets Tally sheets and wealth accumulation analyses for each NEO are reviewed annually before making compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Dont Do    Excessive Risk-Taking in Our Compensation Programs The Long Term Incentive Plans use multiple performance measures, capped payouts and other features intended to minimize the incentive to take overly risky actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Hedging or Pledging Directors and executives are p from hedging, pledging or engaging in any derivatives tra respect to Company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Tax Gross-ups There are no tax gross-ups for perquisites or excise tax gross-ups in the event of a change of control related termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Backdating or Repricing of Stock Options Stock o are never backdated or issued with below-market exerci Re-pricing of stock options without stockholder approval expressly prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Single-Trigger Employment Agreements Any cash payments in executive employment agreements are subject to a double- trigger change in control condition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive Pay Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Centene must leverage its compensation and benefit programs to attract the best talent to compete and achieve aggressive operating objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, Centene views both private equity firms and competitors with larger revenue bases as significant competition for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Centene also recognizes that our Company is a source for these firms and competitors to recruit talent if the appropriate compensation programs are not in place at Centene.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the components of target total compensation, the Compensation Committees competitive objectives are for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: base salaries to approximate the 50th percentile of similarly-sized organizations, based on revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 50th percentile will be targeted in most instances; however, up to the 75th percentile is considered when recruiting talent from significantly larger companies and private equity firms or when the experience of the executive dictates a higher base salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual bonus targets to approximate the 50th percentile of similarly-sized organizations; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: long term incentive targets to approximate the 50th percentile of similarly-sized organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The goal of these objectives is that based on individual performance, actual total compensation will fall at the 50th percentile of total market based compensation for both the healthcare industry peer group and the general industry peer group for expected performance and between the 50th and 75th percentile based on extraordinary performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to achieve these objectives, the Compensation Committee establishes target, market-based total compensation levels (e.g., base salary, annual bonus target and long term incentives) from market data from two different peer groups:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A. Healthcare Industry Managed Care Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using the Standard and Poors Global Industry Classification System (GICS) codes and other relevant industry parameters, Willis Towers Watson and Exequity, LLC analyzed the managed care industry and determined there are three key segments in the industry:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Managed Healthcare Companies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Healthcare Facilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Healthcare Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 46    Centene Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 NOTICE OF MEETING AND PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INFORMATION ABOUT EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on further review by Willis Towers Watson and Exequity, LLC, the following companies were included in the Companys Healthcare Industry Managed Care Peer Group for use in determining compensation for NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MANAGED HEALTH CARE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: B. General Industry Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since there is a market for executive talent both within and outside our industry, we also benchmark against the general industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the market data the Compensation Committee utilizes includes not only the managed healthcare industry peer group of 14 companies, plus a general industry peer group of approximately 400 companies also developed by Willis Towers Watsons Compensation Database (CDB).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benchmarking Methodology
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee engaged Willis Towers Watson to gather, analyze and summarize the market data from the Willis Towers Watson Executive Compensation Database for the CEO and the other four NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee reviewed additional data sources from FW Cook & Co., Inc. and Exequity, LLC in determining the compensation for the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FW Cook & Co., Inc. was retained independently by the Compensation Committee to provide recommendations for the CEOs compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this analysis, we size adjusted both the healthcare and general industry peer data to $40 billion in revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also reviewed the data adjusted to $50 billion to reflect the estimated future revenue, based on our growth pattern combined with the Health Net acquisition, and to provide a more representative depiction of the overall competitive market for talent, as evidenced by several of our executives who came from companies outside of our industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All elements of compensation are valued and reviewed in evaluating the relative competitiveness of our compensation practices against both the market data and the Compensation Committees competitive objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee annually reviews a tally sheet for each NEO, which includes the current value of all outstanding equity-based awards, benefits and perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses the tally sheets to analyze each NEOs base salary, annual incentive target and long term incentive opportunity in relation to the market and each component of compensation as a percentage of total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While reviewing market data to determine appropriate annual base salaries, the Compensation Committee also considers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Chief Executive Officers compensation recommendations for all other NEOs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the scope of responsibility, experience, time in position and individual performance of each officer, including the Chief Executive Officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: each executives leadership performance and potential to enhance long term stockholder value; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: internal equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee rewards NEOs with an Annual Cash Incentive bonus for achieving the Companys EPS objective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee assesses how each NEO contributed to achieving this EPS objective and other pre-determined objectives approved by the Compensation Committee in early February of the current year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee follows a two-step process to determine the amount of bonus earned each year:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. The Company must meet a specific EPS objective during the year before any payments may be made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Company does not meet its threshold performance, no payments are made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, in 2012, the Company did not reach its threshold EPS objective and, accordingly, no annual bonuses were paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. In addition, each NEOs individual performance is assessed by Management and the Compensation Committee against the pre-determined objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If these pre-determined objectives were met, exceeded or not met, then the annual bonus could equal, exceed or be less than target, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual awards under our bonus plan are approved by the Compensation Committee based primarily upon:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: business performance versus our business plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the effectiveness of each executives leadership performance and potential to enhance long term stockholder value;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: argeted bonus amounts, which are based upon market data; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the recommendation of the Chief Executive Officer (for all NEOs other than the CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall, 70% of each award is aligned with the diluted EPS target, and the remaining 30% of each award is aligned with individual performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Cash Incentive Award is calculated as follows, with a maximum payout of 200% of target:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long Term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long term incentive compensation is designed to attract and retain key executives, build an integrated management team, reward for innovation and appropriate risk-taking, balance short term planning with long term successes and align executive and stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR, revenue growth, and pre-tax operating margin targets as well as competitive market practices are all used by the Compensation Committee in determining long term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These long term incentives take the form of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Restricted Stock Units which are based on meeting pre-determined performance targets (pre-tax margin and revenue growth), vest at the end of the three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units which vest over three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Long Term Incentive Plan which is based on meeting three year TSR, pre-tax margin and revenue growth metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options which are granted on a limited basis and vest over three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long term incentives are provided both through equity (PSUs at 60% and RSUs at 40%) and cash, while ensuring that the maximum number of shares of common stock granted in any calendar year (excluding shares granted in connection with an acquisition) does not exceed a level associated with competitive practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excluding acquisitions, the Company does not annually grant equity compensation exceeding 2% of the outstanding shares of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recent years, the equity grants have been trending at approximately 1.5% of outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the growth of the Company, the competitive nature of our business and the necessity of retaining key management level employees, stock grants can be awarded to levels below officers, including directors and managers throughout the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSUs and RSUs are normally granted at the annual December Compensation Committee meeting, but may also be approved at other Compensation Committee meetings for a promotion, extraordinary performance, a newly hired executive or as determined by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash LTIP Award Performance Targets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee utilizes the Cash LTIP, which is a three year performance program, to complement the stock incentive plan, manage dilution and supplement the number of shares available under the Companys stock incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO is awarded a grant at the beginning of the three-year cycle based on the following targets:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman & CEO150% of Prior Years Annual Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other NEOs100% of Prior Years Annual Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash awards are paid annually, if earned, after completion of each 3 year performance cycle, and targets are announced annually prior to the beginning of each 3 year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sets performance targets at levels it believes to be rigorous and challenging.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance criteria may include any of the metrics identified in the plan document.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may determine that the performance parameters used to measure the appropriate pay out include or exclude items which are deemed extraordinary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These items include but are not limited to those stated in the plan document.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order for a NEO to earn a Cash LTIP payout, at least one of the following metric thresholds must be achieved: pre-tax margin percentage, revenue CAGR percentage or TSR relative to the healthcare industry peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These metrics are applicable for the 2015-2017 cycle (awarded in December 2014), the 2016-2018 cycle (awarded in December 2015), and the 2017-2019 cycle (awarded in December 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide our NEOs with a defined contribution 401(k) retirement program which is the same program that is generally provided to all our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide our NEOs with a non-qualified deferred compensation plan to make up for matching contributions that are capped by compensation limits imposed on qualified retirement plans under the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide our NEOs with a defined benefit retirement program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also do not provide retiree medical coverage to our NEOs, with the exception of Mr. Neidorff, as specified in his employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to most other benefits, the benefits provided to NEOs and other executive officers are comparable to those provided to the majority of salaried and hourly Company employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We require all NEOs to have their tax returns prepared or reviewed by an independent certified public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to this requirement, costs related to these services are paid by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each NEO has the option to use a financial advisor for fees that do not exceed $15,000 annually, in total, for both tax preparation and financial advisement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These costs are also fully taxable to them and are not grossed up to cover any personal income tax liability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that additional security is required for the position of Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer and other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to a policy implemented by our Board, Mr. Neidorff is required to use Company provided aircraft for all air travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have an aircraft time sharing agreement with Mr. Neidorff that permits him to reimburse us for incremental costs when he uses the aircraft for personal travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we provide home security services to Mr. Neidorff.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Neidorffs personal use of Company aircraft and home security services are fully taxable to him and are not grossed up to cover his personal income tax liability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Home security services are also provided to our NEOs, and these costs are also fully taxable to them and are not grossed up to cover any personal income tax liability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 4 - Other Compensation Policies and Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Centene utilizes stock ownership guidelines for our NEOs, corporate officers and Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that ownership of our stock helps align the interests of our executives and stockholders and encourages executives to act in a manner that is expected to increase stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock ownership guidelines for our officers are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Minimum Ownership Requirement as a Multiple of Base Salary   Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer     5x  Executive Vice Presidents     2.5x  Senior Vice Presidents     2x  Plan & Specialty Company Presidents and Corporate Vice Presidents     1x
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee annually reviews the stock ownership levels of the Board of Directors and all officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Future stock awards take into consideration the executives level of attainment of the suggested stock ownership amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may elect to award the annual incentive to an executive in stock instead of cash if the suggested stock ownership amount is not achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officers who fail to achieve these ownership levels may not be eligible to receive any stock-based awards until they achieve their required ownership level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares owned directly by the officer (including those held as a joint tenant or as tenant in common), unvested RSUs, shares owned in a self-directed IRA, phantom shares held in the deferred compensation plan and certain shares owned or held for the benefit of a spouse or minor children are counted toward the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options and unearned PSUs are not counted toward the ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has established a policy requiring executive officers to retain ownership of the shares received from the vesting or payout of any RSU award granted under our stock incentive plan (net of any shares used to satisfy tax obligations) for one year following such vesting or payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executive may substitute the tax basis of the shares under restriction for other shares held outright.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the close of the last fiscal year and the date of this report, all NEOs subject to the ownership guidelines are in compliance with the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At $56.51 per share (the December 31, 2016 closing stock price), ownership percentages of our executive officers were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name   Ownership as a Multiple of 2016 Base Salary   Michael F. Neidorff     141.9x  Jeffrey A. Schwaneke     5.8x  Cynthia J. Brinkley     7.9x  Jesse N. Hunter     17.5x  Keith H. Williamson     8.7x
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock ownership guidelines for members of our Board of Directors require them to own 40,000 shares of common stock within 5 years of being appointed to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all directors were in compliance with this requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pledging Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2014, the Board of Directors amended the Companys insider trading policy to prohibit pledging of shares by executive officers and members of the Board of Directors.

sentences.text: As of February 24, 2017, all executive officers and directors were in compliance with this policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Disclosure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is aware of the consequences to companies that have not appropriately balanced risk and rewards in executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that the emphasis on long term performance in the stock incentive plan and the Cash LTIP results in an overall compensation program that does not reward excessive risk-taking for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk is further limited by the ownership guidelines mentioned previously and a clawback provision that provides that any cash bonuses that are paid from the annual incentive plan, Cash LTIP or vesting of performance-based RSUs that are a result of material financial impropriety (as defined by the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors), including but not limited to financial restatements due to these improprieties, may result in any officers becoming obligated to pay back the amount to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation strategy is intended to mitigate risk by emphasizing long term compensation and financial performance measures correlated with growing stockholder value rather than rewarding shorter performance and payout periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A recent review of the Companys compensation programs did not identify any programs that unduly incentivize employees to take any excessive risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Employment Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michael F. Neidorff serves as Chairman of our Board of Directors and our President and Chief Executive Officer pursuan to an employment agreement dated November 8, 2004 (as amended).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this agreement, we paid Mr. Neidorff a 2016 annual salary of $1.5 million and will pay Mr. Neidorff a 2017 annual salary of $1.5 million, which is subject to an annual review by our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Neidorff is eligible for a target annual incentive of 150% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreement also awarded Mr. Neidorff 2,000,000 RSUs as of November 8, 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of these RSUs, 60% vested in 2009 and the remaining 40% vested ratably from 2010 through 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The RSUs and all of the related shares of common stock shall be distributed to Mr. Neidorff on the later of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) January 15 of the first calendar year following termination of Mr. Neidorffs employment or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the date that is six months after Mr. Neidorffs separation of service as defined in the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board of Directors and Mr. Neidorff agreed to extend his contract beyond the previous termination date to ensure continuity in the business under the current regulatory environment and an orderly transition of leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amendment provided that Mr. Neidorff will serve as Executive Chairman for one year after his successor is appointed and as a Non-Executive Chairman thereafter; extended the term of the employment agreement to the 2021 Annual Shareholders Meeting; and provided for the grant of 20,000 stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Neidorff has agreed not to compete with us or solicit any of our employees during the term of his employment and for 12 months thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Neidorffs employment may be terminated by the Company for cause or permanent disability, or by Mr. Neidorff for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cynthia J. Brinkley, Jesse N. Hunter, Jeffrey A. Schwaneke and Keith H. Williamson serve as executive officers pursuant to executive severance and change in control agreements (the agreements, as amended), and their 2017 annual salaries are $675,000, $675,000, $725,000 and $620,000, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreements generally provide that, if within 24 months following a change in control (as defined in the agreements), the executives employment is terminated by the Company other than for cause (as defined in the agreements) or by the executive for good reason (as defined in the agreements), the executive will receive a lump sum cash payment equal to the sum of (1) an amount equal to 24 months of salary,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the average of the executives last two annual bonuses multiplied by two, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) a prorated annual bonus for the year in which the termination occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive also will receive 18 months of medical coverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executives existing equity awards will vest in full at the time of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreements also generally provide that, if an executives employment is terminated by the Company other than for cause or by the executive for good reason in the absence of a change in control, the executive will receive 12 months of salary continuation, a prorated annual bonus for the year in which the termination occurs, 12 months of medical coverage and 12 months of continued vesting of the executives existing equity awards.

sentences.text: In the agreements, the executives agree to non-competition and non-solicitation provisions that extend through the first anniversary of termination of employment, unless the termination was due to a change in control as defined in the agreement.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code generally disallows a tax deduction to a publicly traded company for compensation in excess of $1 million paid to its Chief Executive Officer and its three other most highly compensated executive officers, excluding the Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some types of compensation, including qualified performance-based compensation, will not be subject to the deduction limit if specified requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, we structure and administer our stock incentive plans in a manner intended to comply with the performance-based exception to Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, we intend that our Annual Cash Incentive Plan complies with the performance-based exception to Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, there can be no assurance that compensation attributable to awards granted under our stock incentive plans, our Annual Cash Incentive Plan or our Long Term Incentive Plan will be treated as qualified performance-based compensation under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m)(6), which was enacted as part of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, amended the Code to limit the amount that certain healthcare insurers and providers, including the Company, may deduct for compensation to any employee in excess of $500,000 for a tax year beginning after December 31, 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This legislation does not create any exceptions for performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reserves the right to use its judgment to authorize compensation payments that may be subject to the limit when the Compensation Committee believes such payments are appropriate and in the best interests of our stockholders, after taking into consideration changing business conditions and the performance of its employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were subject to this legislation in 2016 with respect to the former Health Net employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect Centene, as a whole, to be subject to the limitation in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The section below describes the payments that may be made to our NEOs upon termination or a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, pursuant to our executive agreements, a change in control is deemed to occur:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any individual, entity or group (other than a group which includes the executive) acquires 40% or more of the voting power of our outstanding securities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a majority of the incumbent Board of Directors are replaced.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these purposes, the incumbent Board of Directors means the directors who were serving as of the effective date of the applicable executive agreement and any individual who becomes a director subsequent to such date whose election or nomination for election was approved by a majority of such directors, other than in connection with a proxy contest; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the consummation of a merger or consolidation of the Company with another person, other than a merger or consolidation where the individuals and entities who were beneficial owners, respectively, of our outstanding voting securities immediately prior to such merger or consolidation own 50% or more of the then-outstanding shares of the combined voting power of the then-outstanding voting securities of the corporation resulting from such merger or consolidation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts presented below assume the termination or change in control occurred as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs would receive other payments and benefits to which they were already entitled or vested on such date, including amounts under the Deferred Compensation Plan under the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The applicable agreements are discussed in the CD&A under the heading Employment Contracts, Termination of Employment Arrangements, Change in Control Arrangements, and Retirement Provisions included in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change in control cash payments are subject to the conditions of the double-trigger criteria in each of the NEOs employment agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scheffel retired from his position as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer effective March 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with his retirement, the Board approved the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a pro-rated amount of the 2014-2016 Long Term Incentive Plan based on his service during the performance period and the performance metric achieved (as disclosed in the Summary Compensation Table),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a pro-rated amount of the 2015-2017 Long Term Incentive Plan based on his service during the performance period and the performance metric achieved, to be determined and distributed in 2018, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the payout of all unvested performance-based and service-based restricted stock units valued at $3,227,809 based on the February 29, 2016 closing stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scheffel is also entitled to payments under the Companys Deferred Compensation Plan as disclosed in the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Table.

sentences.text: As discussed under Compensation Discussion & Analysis, in February 2014, the Board of Directors amended the Companys insider trading policy to prohibit pledging of shares by executive officers and members of the Board of Directors.

sentences.text: Beneficial ownership is determined in accordance with the rules of the SEC.

sentences.text: To calculate a stockholders percentage of beneficial ownership, we include in the numerator and denominator those shares underlying options beneficially owned by that stockholder that are vested or that will vest within 60 days of February 24, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options held by other stockholders, however, are disregarded in the calculation of beneficial ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the denominator used in calculating beneficial ownership among our stockholders may differ.

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors, executive officers and beneficial owners of more than ten percent of our common stock are required by Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act to file reports with the SEC detailing their beneficial ownership of our common stock and other equity securities and reporting changes in such beneficial ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are required to disclose any late filings of such reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To our knowledge, based solely on our review of copies of reports furnished to us and written representations by the persons required to file these reports that no reports were required, all Section 16(a) filing requirements during 2016 were complied with on a timely basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an executive officer or member of the Board wants to sell shares of the Companys stock, we require them to sell through a Rule 10b5-1 sales plan in order to afford themselves affirmative defenses, protections and safeguards provided by Rule 10b5-1 promulgated under the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Submission of Future Stockholder Proposals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under SEC rules, a stockholder who wishes to present a proposal, including nomination of a director, for inclusion in our proxy statement for our 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders must submit the proposal in writing to Keith H. Williamson, our Secretary, at 7700 Forsyth Boulevard, St. Louis, Missouri 63105, before November 13, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SEC rules set standards for the types of stockholder proposals and the information that must be provided by the stockholder making the request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stockholder may also submit a proposal to be considered at our 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders pursuant to our By-Laws (and not under SEC rules).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that case, the proposal would not be required to be included in our proxy statement for our 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders and the proposal must be received by our Secretary not less than 120 days nor more than 150 days before the first anniversary of the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This notice must include the information required by the provisions of our By-Laws, a copy of which may be obtained by writing to our Secretary at the address specified above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deadline for delivery of a stockholder proposal pursuant to our By-Laws would be between November 26, 2017 and December 26, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have not set a date for our 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the date of our 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders is advanced or delayed by more than 30 days from April 25, 2018, we shall inform our stockholders, in our earliest possible quarterly report on Form 10-Q, of such change and the new dates for submitting stockholder proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some banks, brokers and other nominee record holders may be participating in the practice of householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that only one copy of either the proxy notice or this proxy statement, our 2016 Annual Review and Annual Report on Form 10-K may have been sent to multiple stockholders sharing an address unless the stockholders provide contrary instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will promptly deliver a separate copy of these documents to you if you call, write or e-mail us at:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Centene Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7700 Forsyth Boulevard St. Louis, Missouri 63105 Attn: Keith H. Williamson, Secretary (314) 725-4477 kwilliamson@centene.com
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you want to receive separate copies of our proxy statements and annual reports to stockholders in the future, or if you are receiving multiple copies and would like to receive only one copy for your household, you should contact your bank, broker or other nominee record holder, or you may contact us at the above address, phone number or e-mail address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CENTENE CORPORATION 2012 Stock Incentive Plan, As Amended
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Purpose
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of this 2012 Stock Incentive Plan (the Plan) of Centene Corporation, a Delaware corporation (the Company), is to advance the interests of the Companys stockholders by enhancing the Companys ability to attract, retain and motivate persons who make (or are expected to make) important contributions to the Company, by providing such persons with equity ownership opportunities and performance-based incentives and thereby better aligning the interests of such persons with those of the Companys stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except where the context otherwise requires, the term Company shall include any of the Companys present or future parent or subsidiary corporations as defined in Sections 424
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and any regulations promulgated thereunder (the Code) and any other business venture (including joint venture or limited liability company) in which the Company has a controlling interest, as determined by the Board of Directors of the Company (the Board).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Eligibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Companys employees, officers, directors, consultants and advisors are eligible to be granted options, restricted stock, restricted stock units, stock appreciation rights and any other stock based awards (each, an Award) under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each person who has been granted an Award under the Plan shall be deemed a Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Administration and Delegation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Administration by Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan will be administered by the Compensation Committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee shall have authority to grant Awards and to adopt, amend and repeal such administrative rules, guidelines and practices relating to the Plan as it shall deem advisable, provided that awards to a director may only be recommended by a committee comprised solely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards made to the CEO must be approved by a majority of independent directors of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may correct any defect, supply any omission or reconcile any inconsistency in the Plan or any Award in the manner and to the extent it shall deem expedient to carry the Plan into effect and it shall be the sole and final judge of such expediency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All decisions by the Compensation Committee shall be made in the Compensation Committees sole discretion and shall be final and binding on all persons having or claiming any interest in the Plan or in any Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No director or person acting pursuant to the authority delegated by the Compensation Committee shall be liable for any action or determination relating to or under the Plan made in good faith.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Appointment of Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent permitted by applicable law, the Compensation Committee may delegate any or all of its powers under the Plan to one or more committees or subcommittees of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Centene Corporation    A-1
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: the Board (a Committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All references in the Plan to the Compensation Committee shall mean the Compensation Committee or a subcommittee or the executive officers referred to in Section 3(c) to the extent that the Compensation Committees powers or authority under the Plan have been delegated to such Committee or executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Delegation to Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent permitted by applicable law, the Compensation Committee may delegate to one or more executive officers of the Company the power to grant Awards to employees or officers of the Company or any of its present or future subsidiary corporations and to exercise such other powers under the Plan as the Compensation Committee may determine, provided that the Compensation Committee shall fix the terms of the Awards to be granted by such executive officers (including the exercise price of such Awards, which may include a formula by which the exercise price will be determined) and the maximum number of shares subject to Awards that the executive officers may grant; provided further, however, that no executive officer shall be authorized to grant Awards to any executive officer of the Company, as defined by Rule 3b-7 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act), or to any officer of the Company (as defined by Rule 16a-1 under the Exchange Act).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Stock Available for Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Number of Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to adjustment under Section 7, Awards may be made under the Plan for up to 17,211,406 shares of common stock, $.001 par value per share, of the Company (Common Stock) consisting of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) 4,600,000 shares of Common Stock initially approved,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 2,211,406 shares of Common Stock under the 2003 Stock Incentive Plan that were previously cancelled and converted to shares available under the 2012 Stock Incentive Plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) 3,500,000 shares of Common Stock approved with a previous amendment effective April 22, 2014, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) 6,900,000 shares of Common Stock being approved in connection with this amendment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n addition, shares that are subject to an outstanding award under our 2003 Stock Incentive Plan that in the future are cancelled, terminated, expire, or lapse shall be added to and become available under the 2012 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares issued under the Plan may consist in whole or in part of authorized but unissued shares or treasury shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of counting the number of shares available for the grant of Awards under the Plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) shares of Common Stock covered by SARs (as hereinafter defined) shall be counted against the number of shares available for the grant of Awards under the Plan; provided that independent SARs (as hereinafter defined that may be settled in cash only shall not be so counted;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) if any Award expires or is terminated, surrendered or canceled without having been fully exercised or is forfeited in whole or in part (including as the result of shares of Common Stock subject to such Award being repurchased by the Company at the original issuance price or for a nominal amount pursuant to a contractual repurchase right) , the unused Common Stock covered by such Award shall again be available for the grant of Awards under the Plan; provided, however, in the case of Incentive Stock Options (as hereinafter defined), the foregoing shall be subject to any limitations under the Code;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) shares of Common Stock tendered to the Company by a Participant to (A) purchase shares of Common Stock upon the exercise of an Award or (B) satisfy tax withholding obligations (including
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) shares subject to awards granted under the Plan through the settlement, assumption or substitution of outstanding awards, or through obligations to grant future awards, as a condition of the Company acquiring another entity (Acquisition Awards) shall not be counted against the number of shares available for the grant of Awards under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Sub-limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to adjustment under Section 8, the following sub-limits on the number of shares subject to Awards shall apply:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Per-Participant Limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum number of shares of Common Stock with respect to which Awards, including options and stock appreciation rights, may be granted to any Participant under the Plan shall be 500,000 per calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the foregoing limit, the combination of an Option in tandem with a SAR shall be treated as a single Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The per-Participant limit described in this Section 4(b)(1) shall be construed and applied consistently with Section 162(m) of the Code or any successor provision thereto (Section 162(m)).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) General.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may grant options to purchase Common Stock (each, an Option) and determine the number of shares of Common Stock to be covered by each Option, the exercise price of each Option and the conditions and limitations applicable to the exercise of each Option, including conditions relating to applicable federal or state securities laws, as it considers necessary or advisable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An Option that is not intended to be an Incentive Stock Option (as hereinafter defined) shall be designated a Nonstatutory Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Incentive Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An Option that the Compensation Committee intends to be an incentive stock option as defined in Section 422 of the Code (an Incentive Stock Option) shall only be granted to employees of Centene Corporation, any of Centene Corporations present or future parent or subsidiary corporations as defined in Sections 424
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) of the Code, and any other entities the employees of which are eligible to receive Incentive Stock Options under the Code, and shall be subject to and shall be construed consistently with the requirements of Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall have no liability to a Participant, or any other party, if an Option (or any part thereof) that is intended to be an Incentive Stock Option is not an Incentive Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Exercise Price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee shall establish the exercise price at the time each Option is granted and specify it in the applicable option agreement, provided, however, that the exercise price shall be not less than 100% of the fair market value of the Common Stock, as determined by the Compensation Committee, at the time the Option is granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Duration of Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Option shall be exercisable at such times and subject to such terms and conditions as the Compensation Committee may specify in the applicable option agreement, provided, however, that no Option will be granted for a term in excess of 10 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) Exercise of Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options may be exercised by delivery to the Company of a written notice of exercise signed by the proper person or by any other form of notice (including electronic notice) approved by the Compensation Committee together with payment in full as specified in Section 5

sentences.text: Common Stock purchased upon the exercise of an Option granted under the Plan shall be paid for as follows:

sentences.text: (1) in cash or by check, payable to the order of the Company;

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) Substitute Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with a merger or consolidation of an entity with the Company or the acquisition by the Company of property or stock of an entity, the Compensation Committee may grant Options in substitution for any options or other stock or stock-based Awards granted by such entity or an affiliate thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Substitute Options may be granted on such terms as the Compensation Committee deems appropriate in the circumstances, notwithstanding any limitations on Options contained in the other sections of this Section 5 or in Section 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. Restricted Stock; Restricted Stock Units; Other Stock Based Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may grant Awards entitling recipients to acquire shares of Common Stock (Restricted Stock), subject to the right of the Company to repurchase all or part of such shares at their issue price or other stated or formula price (or to require forfeiture of such shares or repurchase of such shares for a nominal amount if issued at no cost) from the recipient in the event that conditions specified by the Compensation Committee in the applicable Award are not satisfied prior to the end of the applicable restriction period or periods established by the Compensation Committee for such Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead of granting Awards for Restricted Stock, the Compensation Committee may grant Awards entitling the recipient to receive shares of Common Stock to be delivered in the future (Restricted Stock Units) subject to such terms and conditions on the delivery of the shares of Common Stock as the Compensation Committee shall determine (each Award for Restricted Stock or Restricted Stock Units, a Restricted Stock Award).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may also permit an exchange of unvested shares of Common Stock that have already been delivered to a Participant for an instrument evidencing the right to future delivery of Common Stock at such time or times, and on such conditions, as the Compensation Committee shall specify.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee may issue an Award that has a value based on the value of shares, including but not limited to grants of stock and grants of rights to receive stock in the future (Other Stock Based Awards).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Terms and Conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1) The Compensation Committee shall determine the terms and conditions of any such Restricted Stock Award, including the conditions for repurchase (or forfeiture) and the issue price, if any.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A-4    Centene Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 NOTICE OF MEETING AND PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: APPENDIX A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee shall also determine the terms and conditions of any Other Stock Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may issue an Other Stock Based Award which includes, but is not limited to, the right to receive upon grant fully vested shares of stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) If the Compensation Committee determines to grant any Restricted Stock Awards designed to satisfy the requirements of Section 162(m)(4)(C) of the Code with respect to remuneration payable to a covered employee as defined in Section 162(m)(3) of the Code (Covered Employee) solely on account of one or more performance goals (Performance Goals) to be achieved during a performance period (Performance Period), the following requirements shall apply:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (A)  (i) The Performance Goals upon which the payment or vesting of an Award to a Covered Employee pursuant to this Section 6(b)(2) shall be limited to the following performance measures (Performance Measures).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any of the following Performance Measures that are financial metrics, may be determined in accordance with United States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) or may be adjusted when established (or to the extent permitted under Section 162(m) of the Code, at any time thereafter) to include or exclude any items otherwise includable or excludable under GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) net earnings or net income (before or after taxes),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) earnings per share,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) net sales or revenue growth,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) net operating profit (before and after taxes),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) return measures (including, but not limited to, return on assets, capital, invested capital, equity, sales, or revenue),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) cash flow (including, but not limited to, operating cash flow, free cash flow, cash flow return on equity, and cash flow return on investment),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) earnings before or after taxes, interest, depreciation, and/or amortization,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) gross or operating margins,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) productivity ratios,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (j) share price (including, but not limited to, growth measures and total shareholder return),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k) expense targets,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l) margins,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (m) operating efficiency,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (n) market share,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (o) customer satisfaction,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (p) working capital targets, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (q) economic value added (net operating profit after tax minus (the sum of capital multiplied by the cost of capital)).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) As the Compensation Committee may deem appropriate:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) any of the foregoing Performance Measure(s) may be used to measure the performance of the Company, a subsidiary, and/or affiliate of the Company as a whole or any business unit of the Company, subsidiary, and/or affiliate or any combination thereof during the Performance Period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) any of the foregoing Performance Measures may be used to compare the performance of the Company, a subsidiary and/or affiliate of the Company as a whole or any business unit of the Company, subsidiary and/or affiliate to the performance of a group of comparator companies, or published or special index that the Compensation Committee, in its sole discretion, deems appropriate; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the Compensation Committee may select Performance Measure (j) above as compared to various stock market indices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) The Compensation Committee may provide in any such Award that any evaluation of performance may include or exclude any of the following events that occurs during a Performance Period:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) asset write-downs,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) litigation or claim judgments or settlements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the effect of changes in tax laws, accounting principles, or other laws or provisions affecting reported results,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) any reorganization and restructuring programs,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) extraordinary nonrecurring items as described in Accounting Principles Board Opinion No. 30 and/or in managements discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations appearing in the Companys annual report to shareholders for the applicable year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) acquisitions or divestitures, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) foreign exchange gains and losses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such inclusions or exclusions shall be prescribed in a form that meets the requirements of Code Section 162(m) for deductibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (B) The Performance Period for any Award pursuant to this Section 6(b)(2) shall not be less than one taxable year of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (C) The maximum number of shares the Compensation Committee may grant to a Covered Employee during a taxable year of the Company pursuant to this Section 6(b)(2) shall be 500,000 shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (D) The Performance Goals for any Award pursuant to this Section 6(b)(2) shall be memorialized in writing and furnished to affected Covered Employees not later than 90 days after the beginning of the Performance Period to which they apply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (E) The Compensation Committee shall certify in writing the accomplishment of the Performance Goals related to an Award before the Award can become unconditional.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (F) Awards that are intended to qualify as Performance-Based Compensation may not be adjusted upward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee shall retain the discretion to adjust such Awards downward, either on a formula or discretionary basis or any combination, as the Compensation Committee determines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (G) In the event that applicable tax and/or securities laws change to permit Compensation Committee discretion to alter the governing Performance Measures without obtaining shareholder approval of such changes, the Compensation Committee shall have sole discretion to make such changes without obtaining shareholder approval, provided the exercise of such discretion does not violate Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in the event that the Compensation Committee determines that it is advisable to grant Awards that shall not qualify as Performance-Based Compensation, the Compensation Committee may make such grants without satisfying the requirements of Code Section 162(m) and base vesting on Performance Measures other than those set forth in this Section 6(b)(2).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (H) Dividends or dividend equivalents shall not be paid on any unvested shares or units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (I) This Section 6(b)(2) is designed to comply with the requirements of Section 162(m)(4)(C) of the Code and regulations issued thereunder and all provisions of this Section 6(b)(2) shall be applied consistent therewith.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Stock Certificates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stock certificates issued in respect of a Restricted Stock Award, if applicable, shall be registered in the name of the Participant and, unless otherwise determined by the Compensation Committee, deposited by the Participant, together with a stock power endorsed in blank, with the Company (or its designee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the expiration of the applicable restriction periods, the Company (or such designee) shall deliver the certificates no longer subject to such restrictions to the Participant or if the Participant has died, to the beneficiary designated, in a manner determined by the Compensation Committee, by a Participant to receive amounts due or exercise rights of the Participant in the event of the Participants death (the Designated Beneficiary).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the absence of an effective designation by a Participant, Designated Beneficiary shall mean the Participants estate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7. Stock Appreciation Rights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) General.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Stock Appreciation Right (SAR) is an Award entitling the holder, upon exercise, to receive an amount in Common Stock determined by reference to appreciation, from and after the date of grant, in the fair market value of a share of Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The date as of which such appreciation or other measure is determined shall be the exercise date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs may be granted in tandem with, or independently of, Options granted under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee shall establish the exercise price at the time each SAR is granted and specify it in the applicable SAR agreement, provided, however, that the exercise price shall be not less than 100% of the fair market value of the Common Stock, as determined by the Compensation Committee, at the time the SAR is granted and no SAR will be granted for a term in excess of 10 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Tandem Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When SARs are expressly granted in tandem with Options,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the SAR will be exercisable only at such time or times, and to the extent, that the related Option is exercisable (except to the extent designated by the Compensation Committee in connection with a Change in Control) and will be exercisable in accordance with the procedure required for exercise of the related Option;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the SAR will terminate and no longer be exercisable upon the termination or exercise of the related Option, except to the extent designated by the Compensation Committee in connection with a Change in Control and except that a SAR granted with respect to less than the ful number of shares covered by an Option will not be reduced until the number of shares as to which the related Option has been exercised or has terminated exceeds the number of shares not covered by the SAR;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the Option will terminate and no longer be exercisable upon the exercise of the related SAR; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the SAR will be transferable only with the related Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A SAR not expressly granted in tandem with an Option will become exercisable at such time or times, and on such conditions, as the Compensation Committee may specify in the SAR Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs may be exercised by delivery to the Company of a written notice of exercise signed by the proper person or by any other form of notice (including electronic notice) approved by the Compensation Committee, together with any other documents required by the Compensation Committee.

sentences.text: 8. Adjustments for Changes in Common Stock and Certain Other Events
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Changes in Capitalization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of any stock split, reverse stock split, stock dividend, recapitalization, combination of shares, reclassification of shares, spin-off, any reorganization (whether or not such reorganization comes within the definition of such term in Code Section 368) or other similar change in capitalization or event, or any distribution to holders of Common Stock other than a normal cash dividend,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the number and class of securities available under the Plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the per-Participant limit set forth in Section 4(b), and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) in the number and class of and/or price of shares of Common Stock subject to outstanding Awards granted under the Plan, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the repurchase price per share subject to each outstanding Restricted Stock Award shall be appropriately adjusted by the Company (or substituted Awards may be made, if applicable) to the extent the Compensation Committee shall determine, in good faith, that such an adjustment (or substitution) is necessary and appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) Liquidation or Dissolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a proposed liquidation or dissolution of the Company, the Compensation Committee shall upon written notice to the Participants provide that all then unexercised Options will
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) become exercisable in full as of a specified time at least 10 business days prior to the effective date of such liquidation or dissolution and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) terminate effective upon such liquidation or dissolution, except to the extent exercised before such effective date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may specify the effect of a liquidation or dissolution on any Restricted Stock Award granted under the Plan at the time of the grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9. General Provisions Applicable to Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Transferability of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards shall not be sold, assigned, transferred, pledged or otherwise encumbered by the person to whom they are granted, either voluntarily or by operation of law, except by will or the laws of descent and distribution or, other than in the case of an Incentive Stock Option, pursuant to a qualified domestic relations order, and, during the life of the Participant, shall be exercisable only by the Participant; provided that the Compensation Committee may permit or provide in an Award for the gratuitous transfer of the Award by the Participant to or for the benefit of any immediate family member, family trust or family partnership established solely for the benefit of the Participant and/or an immediate family member thereof if, with respect to such proposed transferee, the Company would be eligible to use a registration statement on Form S-8 for the registration of the sale of the Common Stock subject to such Award under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and provided further that the Company shall not be required to recognize any such transfer until such time as the Participant and such permitted transferee shall, as a condition to such transfer, deliver to the Company a written instrument in form and substance satisfactory to the Company confirming that such transferee shall be bound by all of the terms and conditions of the Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: References to a Participant, to the extent relevant in the context, shall include references to authorized transferees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
